text: Is there a way to duplicate a table so that I do'nt need to recreate the columns, I'm creating 50 tables that are all pretty much the same
You could use the API to create them. Should be a pretty simple POST: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/create_table>
Should give same origin hubl templates the ability to directly post to the HubDBs for that portal :X
I’m using a janky AJAX workaround right now to get table column names, create a stringified payload, and post to the create_table endpoint to create my new tables

Not that server-side setups are all that difficult, but if I’m already building so much HubL to query and use the HubDB data, it’d be nice to accept user input and push it to the table (with authentication of some sort)
I used my postman google chrome extension (which may actually be an app) and just posted to the api
change your method to post, and add your URL and API KEY
next step place in your JSON to build
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F4Y2EQ05U/pasted_image_at_2017_04_10_10_23_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-04-10, 10:23 PM>

All of that is based upon the API documentation.

This allowed me to replicate 53 tables in about 5 minutes, typing in the new name for the table, command-enter, then the next state/territory

I'm sure if you needed to do this programmatically more, it would be ideal to setup your own objects to repeat this in JS or php or whatever you code in, but for something simple like this that I will never need again, building out the json was super quick for the columns, and I always have POSTMAN so that I can test API stuff before I write my final code.
